ns:common.document.text: Smith is a hypothetical machine assembly language invented by Chris Pressey of Cat's Eye Technologies. It is remarkable for its lack of control transfer instructions, having no branch, jump, or compare instructions. The program counter is incremented by one (and only one) after each instruction is executed, and program control is accomplished through the use of self-modifying code.\nSMITH provides the following instruction set:\nA example of the classic \"Hello, world\" program is:
